metadata.title: CVE-2018-19217 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS-preview 22.04 LTS (jammy) - low
metadata.description:
** DISPUTED ** In ncurses, possibly a 6.x version, there is a NULL pointerdereference at the function _nc_name_match that will lead to a denial ofservice attack. NOTE: the original report stated version 6.1, but the issuedid not reproduce for that version according to the maintainer or areliable third-party.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-19217` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

lib32ncurses6 - 6.3-2
lib32ncursesw6 - 6.3-2
lib32tinfo6 - 6.3-2
lib64ncurses6 - 6.3-2
lib64ncursesw6 - 6.3-2
lib64tinfo6 - 6.3-2
libncurses5 - 6.3-2
libncurses6 - 6.3-2
libncursesw5 - 6.3-2
libncursesw6 - 6.3-2
libtinfo5 - 6.3-2
libtinfo6 - 6.3-2
ncurses-base - 6.3-2
ncurses-bin - 6.3-2
ncurses-examples - 6.3-2
ncurses-term - 6.3-2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: ncurses package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '6.3-2').
